Spanish: pegamento, cola (< Lat. pix, < Lat. coloere)
maceta, tiesto (< Hisp.-Ar. maceta, maybe < Ital. mazzetto; < Lat. testu)
tienda, lona, toldo (< Lat. tenda < tendĕre; < Fr. Olonne; < Fr. taud < Old Germ. tialz)
codicia, avaricia, afán (< Lat. cupiditia; < Lat. avaritia; probably < Lat. afannae)

Portuguese: embaraçada (< Lat. in + O.Port. baraça, of uncertain origin)

Spanish: agotamiento, fatiga, extenuación (< Lat.gutta; < Lat.fatigāre; < Lat. extenuāre)
raro, extraño, peculiar (< Lat. rarus; < Lat. extrāneus; < Lat. peculiāris)
enfermedad, achaque, plaga, peste (< Lat. infirmitas; < Ar. šakā; < Lat. plaga; < Lat. pestis )
chillido, berrido (< Lat. cisclare; < Lat. barrire)
taller; taller de coches; taller mecánico de autos (< Old Fr. astelier; < Old Fr. estalier + Lat. cocca; < Old Fr. astelier + Lat. mechanicus + Gr. αὐτο)
English: auto repair centre, repair garage, workshop

Spanish: empresa; compañía; sociedad, negocio (< Lat. prenhendere; companio; societas; nec otium)
English: business, firm, company, corporation, enterprise, venture, establishment, group, house

Spanish: riesgo (< Arabic rizq[5] or maybe Italian rischio}})
